original_title: Sri Lanka sells 2030 bond at 15.67-pct after DDR plan
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka raised 100 billion rupees in bonds maturing on 2028 and 2030 on July 13, data from the state debt office showed, as bond auctions resumed following the announcement of a domestic debt restructuring plan.
The debt office sold a 01.05.2028 bond at 15.74 percent raising the entire 50 billion rupees offered.
A 2030 bond was sold to yield 15.67 percent, also raising all 50 billion rupees offered.
Sri Lanka halted bond actions earlier in 2023 after threat of domestic debt re-structure pushed interest rates close to 30 percent.
A debt restructure plan announced recently excluded investors other than super pension funds, allowing markets to resume and investor to bid.
